questions.question: If you encounter a flooded roadway, you should:
choices: Turn around and seek an alternate route
Grip the steering wheel firmly and keep your speed
Stop and immediately abandon your car

questions.question: When driving on a slippery surface such as snow or ice, you should:
choices: Pump your brakes to keep them from freezing

You have young children in the car

choices: Road services and evacuation route information

choices: May turn in the direction of the arrow

questions.question: You should expect to be in a large truck's blind spot if you:
choices: Cannot see the truck driver in the truck's side mirror

questions.question: When should you use your high-beam headlights?
choices: At night on open roads with no streetlights
At night and when approaching another vehicle from behind

questions.question: To be eligible for a level 2 (intermediate) license when you are 16 years of age but less than 18 years you must:
choices: Have held a level 1 license for one year
Have held a level 1 license for 180 days

questions.question: When driving beside a motorcycle, you should:
choices: Share the same lane if the speed limit is 35 mph or less
Keep two feet between your car and the motorcycle
Not drive in the motorcyclist's lane

questions.question: Signs that warn you of possible dangers ahead are:

choices: When no red light is flashing

choices: Everywhere a pedestrian crosses the street

choices: By turning your head and looking over your shoulder

choices: Hit the brakes as quickly as possible
Swing back onto the pavement as quickly as possible
Steer straight and ease off the gas pedal

questions.question: To reduce the risk of hand, wrist, or arm injury if the airbag is deployed, it is a good idea to grip the steering wheel by:
choices: Both hands in 10 and 2 o'clock positions
Both hands in 8 and 4 o'clock positions

questions.question: When must you use your headlights?
choices: When you cannot see objects clearly due to smoke
When you turn off your windshield wipers

questions.question: What is the meaning of this sign?
choices: The traffic signal ahead is broken
There is a traffic signal ahead
The traffic signal ahead will show a red light

questions.question: This sign tells you:
choices: The recommended safe speed you should use
The maximum speed you must not exceed
The minimum speed you must use

questions.question: A traffic officer is directing you to do a U-turn against existing signs. What should you do?
choices: Wait until somebody else follows the directions
Obey the officer and make the U-turn

choices: Avoid signaling until you are leaving the deceleration lane
Do not slow down until you move into the deceleration lane
Slow down well ahead of the deceleration lane

questions.question: Which of the following is the best method to improve safety when driving at night?
choices: Always use your high beam headlights
Always look down to the right side of the road

choices: Avoid looking at different objects. Keep your eyes focused on the road ahead
Stop and take regular breaks, even if you are not tired

questions.question: What does this sign mean?

The highway ahead is divided into two one-way roadways

choices: It is a lane for slow moving traffic

choices: Keep speed unless you hear a train approaching

questions.question: Your lane ends ahead, and there is a large truck in the lane beside you. What is the best thing to do?
choices: Speed up and merge in front of the truck. You have the right-of-way
Stay alongside the truck and assume that the truck will slow down
Slow down and merge behind the truck

questions.question: When an emergency vehicle with flashing red or blue lights and activated siren approaches, you must:
choices: Speed up until you can turn off the road
Pull to the right side of the road and stop
Continue driving in the right-hand lane

questions.question: When should you use your horn?
choices: When necessary to avoid a crash

To show other drivers that they made a mistake

choices: You are already driving the wrong way on a one-way street

questions.question: If you have been drinking alcohol, what will help you to sober up?

choices: Lane C with a steady green arrow
Lane A with a steady red X
Lane B with a steady green arrow

choices: Pass the bicyclist closely and quickly
Honk your horn to warn the bicyclist

Another road enters the highway from the direction shown

choices: Turn your head and look out the rear window

questions.question: Two solid yellow lines mean no passing. Do not cross these lines unless:
choices: You need to pass a motorcyclist
There is no traffic in the opposite direction

choices: Within the distance you can see ahead

choices: More than 18 inches from the curb

More than ten inches from the curb

choices: In either seat, it doesn't matter

choices: Keep your eyes on the road and shift to neutral
